segments.text: The kitchen feels cozy and ordinary, yet there’s an undercurrent of chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the light streaming in through the window, illuminating the dust motes in the air.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then my eyes are drawn to the puddle growing at the woman's feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her indifference to the water is almost infuriating; how can she not see it?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And there’s the boy, precariously balanced on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a disaster waiting to happen, yet she remains engrossed in her dishwashing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene outside is so peaceful, contrasting sharply with the ticking time bomb inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
